verses.roman:
keśāgra-śateka-bhāga punaḥ śatāṁśa kari
tāra sama sūkṣma jīvera 'svarūpa' vicāri

synonyms: keśa-agra—from the tip of a hair; śata-eka—one hundred; bhāga—divisions; punaḥ—again; śata-aṁśa—one hundred divisions; kari—making; tāra sama—equal to that; sūkṣma—very fine; jīvera—of the living entity; sva-rūpa—the actual form; vicāri—I consider.
translation: "The length and breadth of the living entity is described as one tenthousandth part of the tip of a hair. This is the original subtle nature of the living entity.
